docs.text: Machine Learning Toronto Welcome to MLTO Machine Learning Toronto (MLTO) is a vibrant community of AI and machine learning enthusiasts in the Greater Toronto Area. We bring together professionals, researchers, and enthusiasts to share knowledge, network, and explore the latest developments in artificial intelligence. Upcoming Events Check out our upcoming events on our events calendar Our Sponsors We are grateful to our sponsors who help make our events and community initiatives possible. Interested in becoming a sponsor? Contact us ! Join Our Community Join MLTO Upcoming Events Contact Us

docs.text: Machine Learning Toronto (MLTO) is a vibrant community of AI and machine learning enthusiasts in the Greater Toronto Area. We bring together professionals, researchers, and enthusiasts to share knowledge, network, and explore the latest developments in artificial intelligence.

docs.text: Mission & Vision Our Mission Our mission is to create a community of like-minded individuals who are passionate about machine learning, artificial intelligence, generative AI, large language models, and all the developments around these topics in industry and the world at large. We aim to provide a space for members to learn, share knowledge, and connect with others in the artificial intelligence space within the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). Our Vision Our goal is to foster an inclusive environment that encourages openness, learning, genuine connection, and discussion around developments in and use of AI. We believe that by bringing together individuals from diverse backgrounds, we can create a space that promotes learning and growth in the field for the benefit of all involved. What We Do Host regular meetups and events featuring industry experts and researchers Provide networking opportunities for AI professionals and enthusiasts Create a supportive environment for learning and knowledge sharing Connect members with job opportunities and career development resources Promote diversity and inclusion in the AI community
docs.title: Mission & Vision

docs.title: What We Do

docs.text: Leadership Team Mario Gibney is a former English teacher who transitioned to tech after developing interests in bitcoin and AI. Following work at several bitcoin startups, he shifted focus to AI Safety, where he's established numerous community groups. He currently runs Trajectory Labs, a coworking and events space for AI Safety researchers in Toronto, and began collaborating with Myles in 2024 to operate MLTO. Myles Harrison is a data scientist and consultant turned entrepreneur and company principal of PRAKTIKAI. Previously he was the global lead of the Data Science program at a tech bootcamp and designed and taught his own free and pay-what-you-can online curricula in natural language processing and generative AI. He has been deeply involved with the Toronto tech community for over a decade, as a regular speaker at events, the creator and organizer of the Data Drinks networking group, and now as an organizer of MLTO. Our Volunteers We are grateful to our dedicated volunteers who help make MLTO possible: Obinna Onyema is a software developer with a knack for building data infrastructure for analytics and AI use cases. He's worked across banking, digital marketing, and travel, and enjoys solving real-world problems with AI. He's also big on mentoring, process improvement, and community work. Curious, adaptable, and always learning, Obinna's goal is to lead innovation in AI and make a meaningful impact through data. Armen Matoosian is a Toronto-based finance and business professional with a background in capital markets, strategic planning, and financial analysis. With a growing interest in data science and machine learning, he is actively upskilling through projects like the "100 Days of Code" and contributing to the local AI community as a volunteer with Machine Learning Toronto (MLTO). Armen brings a multidisciplinary perspective, combining financial expertise with a passion for emerging technologies and community engagement. Bobby Broz is a Senior Associate at a payments startup. His experience in sales, supporting tech customers at scale, and creating analytical solutions makes him versatile, allowing him to work on both the technical and business sides of a company. He enjoys solving real-world problems and building tools that make complex data more actionable. He is passionate about continuous learning, community collaboration, and exploring the impact of emerging technologies. Mimi Yu is a software developer with a focus on frontend development and hands-on experience in full-stack and cloud technologies. She has worked on projects across education, NGOs, and commercial sectors, creating user-friendly digital experiences. A curious lifelong learner, she's now exploring how AI can power meaningful solutions. She joined this organization to support community growth and is always open to collaborating on innovative, AI-driven projects. Maram Jawass is a second-year Computer Science student with a strong interest in artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, and web development. Passionate about continuous learning, she actively explores the evolving landscape of technology to stay ahead in the field. She is also a host of TechBiz Talks, a podcast for insightful conversations about tech trends, career tips, and industry perspectives. Maram's goal is to keep expanding her knowledge and contribute meaningfully to the future & safety of technology. Tam Le is an eccentric web developer and aspiring elite vibe coder. Loves to explore and tinker and to make artsy stuff out of code and words. Happy to share and teach what he knows, and to learn as much as he can without going insane. Studying yoga and is obsessed about fitness, nutrition, and ultimately personal and collective wellness. Having traded his brain for brawn, Tam is currently working to restore the balance--to be a good example of a healthy modern caveman working with tech, and to help others along on the path. Neha K is a Senior Product Manager with several years of experience building and commercializing AI-powered B2B SaaS products across cybersecurity, insurance, health-tech and retail-tech. With a technical background in computer science and software engineering, combined with an MBA, she specializes in translating complex AI capabilities into user-friendly products that solve critical business problems. Neha is currently working on independent AI projects and is passionate about advancing machine learning applications. Interested in joining our team? Check out our volunteer opportunities !

docs.text: Code of Conduct Our Pledge We as members, contributors, and leaders pledge to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation. Our Standards Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment for our community include: Demonstrating empathy and kindness toward other people Being respectful of differing opinions, viewpoints, and experiences Giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility and apologizing to those affected by our mistakes Focusing on what is best for the overall community Examples of unacceptable behavior include: The use of sexualized language or imagery, and sexual attention or advances Trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks Public or private harassment Publishing others' private information without explicit permission Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting Enforcement Responsibilities Community leaders are responsible for clarifying and enforcing our standards of acceptable behavior and will take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any behavior that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful. Enforcement Guidelines Community leaders will follow these Community Impact Guidelines in determining the consequences for any action they deem in violation of this Code of Conduct: Correction : Community Impact: Use of inappropriate language or other behavior deemed unprofessional or unwelcome in the community. Consequence: A private, written warning from community leaders, providing clarity around the nature of the violation and an explanation of why the behavior was inappropriate. Warning : Community Impact: A violation through a single incident or series of actions. Consequence: A warning with consequences for continued behavior. No interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, for a specified period of time. Temporary Ban : Community Impact: A serious violation of community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: A temporary ban from any sort of interaction or public communication with the community for a specified period of time. Permanent Ban : Community Impact: Demonstrating a pattern of violation of community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment of an individual, or aggression toward or disparagement of classes of individuals. Consequence: A permanent ban from any sort of public interaction within the community. Reporting Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported to the community leaders responsible for enforcement at contact page . All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly. Attribution This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant , version 2.0.
docs.title: Code of Conduct

docs.text: Community Guidelines Our Values Inclusivity : We welcome and respect people of all backgrounds and experience levels Learning : We encourage curiosity and continuous learning Collaboration : We believe in working together to achieve common goals Respect : We treat everyone with dignity and respect Integrity : We maintain high ethical standards in all our activities Guidelines Be Respectful : Treat all community members with respect and kindness Be Inclusive : Welcome and support newcomers to the community Share Knowledge : Contribute to the learning environment by sharing your expertise Be Professional : Maintain professional conduct in all interactions Respect Privacy : Protect the privacy of community members No Harassment : Harassment of any kind will not be tolerated No Spam : Keep discussions relevant and avoid self-promotion Follow the Code of Conduct : Adhere to our Code of Conduct Reporting Concerns If you experience or witness any behavior that violates these guidelines, please report it to the leadership team immediately. You can contact us through our contact page .
docs.title: Guidelines
